Sipna College of Enginnering And Technology, Amravati

Event Name : Robotics

Date and Time : 8th February 2024

Location : Sipna College for Engineering And Technology, Amravati

General Rules:

  • 1) Bring your college ID Cards and Receipt on event day
  • 2) All the participants will be awarded with "Participation Certificates ".

Coordinators :

  • Dhiraj Mishra : 8766870075

ROBO-RACE

  • ROBO- RACE Does racing run in your blood? Are you diehard fan of NFS most wanted, Formula 1 or any other racing game? If true, then we bring you the racing experience which will leave you thrilled.

Robot Specification :

  • 1) The robot should be fit in the dimensions 25*25*25 cm (L*B*H)
  • 2) Weight of robot should not exceed more than 3 kg.
  • 3) Robot should be controlled by wired mechanism throughout the race (Wireless bots are not allowed).
  • 4) Length of the wire must be sufficient to cover the arena
  • 5) Wired robot will be provided by us or you can come with your robot with aboves pecifications

Rules and Regulations :

  • 1) A team can consist of min 1 and max 3 participants
  • 2) Entry fees: 100/- per team
  • 3) A team may consist of students from different colleges and each member should bring their college ID proof. POWER SUPPLY-Maximum allowed supply is 12 volt, 2 amp, will be provided by us. (External power supply is not allowed.) Maximum 3 hand touches is allowed
  • 4) Organizers may change the rules as per situation. Final decision will be taken by judges. Readymade toys cars and LEGO are not allowed.
  • 5) If the participant causes any kind of physical damage to the opponent participants then, they will immediately disqualify. If the winner is not decided in the race then both the opponents will get disqualified.

Prizes :
Winner :₹7000
Runner Up: ₹5000

ROBO-Long Jump

  • A trick is always to try collect the tries like trophies and you will never loose. You can't always wait for the perfect time sometimes you must dare to jump.

Rules and Regulations :

  • 1) A team consist of min 1 and max 2 participants
  • 2) Entry fees: 100/- per team
  • 3) A team may consist of students from different colleges and each member should bring their college ID proof
  • 4) Robots will be provided by us. Two chances will be given
  • 5) Organizers may change the rules as per situation per situation
  • 6) Final decision will be taken by judges
  • 7) Readymade toys cars and LEGO are not allowed

Robot Specification :

  • 1) The robot should be fit in the dimensions 25*25*25 cm (L*B*H)
  • 2) Weight of robot should not exceed more than 3 kg.
  • 3) Robot should be controlled by wired mechanism throughout the race (Wireless bots are not allowed).
  • 4) Length of the wire must be sufficient to cover the arena
  • 5) Wired robot will be provided by us or you can come with your robot with aboves pecifications

Prizes :
Winner :₹3000
Runner Up: ₹2000

ROBO-SOCCER

  • Design a manually controlled wired ROBOT that can play soccer on an arena specially designed for robotics soccer match.

Robot Specification :

  • 1) Each robot should be manually controlled vehicle
  • 2) The dimension of the robot should not exceed 33 cm (1)*25cm(b)*25 cm(h)
  • 3) The robot should be remotely controlled and the connections (the wires, for instance) between the control unit and the robot should be slag at all times
  • 4) Readymade toys and cars or LEGO are not allowed
  • 5) Weight of the robot must not exceed 3kg (0.5 tolerance).

Rules and Regulations :

  • 1) Each team can consist of min 1 and max 3 participants
  • 2) Entry fees: 300/- per team
  • 3) There will be a maximum permitted time for different rounds ranging from 3 to 5 minutes. (1.5 min one half and 2 min maintenance break)
  • 4) We will provide power point with 230 V 50 Hz on supply on extension cord and multipoint The potential difference between any two points must not exceed 12V at any point of the run
  • 5) In final in case of a tie extra time of 1 min will be given which will be in two half's of 0.5 min each round each match will be of 2 to 5 min in two half's of 1 min each. Half time will be 2 min in which teams can repair their bots in case of any damage
  • 6. The team will scores the first goal in the extra time, will be the winner.
  • 7) If the winner is not decided after the extra time then event manager will decided how to separate the teams.

Prizes :
Winner :₹5000
Runner Up: ₹3000
